1.verse: In the second year of King Darius, ( A ) on the first day of the sixth month, the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai ( B ) to Zerubbabel ( C ) son of Shealtiel, governor ( D ) of Judah, and to Joshua ( E ) son of Jozadak,  ( F ) the high priest: ( G )

2.verse: This is what the Lord Almighty ( H ) says: “These people ( I ) say, ‘The time has not yet come to rebuild the Lord ’s house. ( J ) ’”

3.verse: Then the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai: ( K )

4.verse: “Is it a time for you yourselves to be living in your paneled houses, ( L ) while this house remains a ruin? ( M ) ”

5.verse: Now this is what the Lord Almighty says: “Give careful thought ( N ) to your ways.

6.verse: You have planted much, but harvested little. ( O ) You eat, but never have enough. ( P ) You drink, but never have your fill. ( Q ) You put on clothes, but are not warm. You earn wages, ( R ) only to put them in a purse with holes in it.”

7.verse: This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Give careful thought ( S ) to your ways.

8.verse: Go up into the mountains and bring down timber ( T ) and build my house, so that I may take pleasure ( U ) in it and be honored, ( V ) ” says the Lord .

9.verse: “You expected much, but see, it turned out to be little. ( W ) What you brought home, I blew ( X ) away. Why?” declares the Lord Almighty. “Because of my house, which remains a ruin, ( Y ) while each of you is busy with your own house.

10.verse: Therefore, because of you the heavens have withheld ( Z ) their dew ( AA ) and the earth its crops. ( AB )

11.verse: I called for a drought ( AC ) on the fields and the mountains, ( AD ) on the grain, the new wine, ( AE ) the olive oil ( AF ) and everything else the ground produces, on people and livestock, and on all the labor of your hands. ( AG ) ”

12.verse: Then Zerubbabel ( AH ) son of Shealtiel, Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest, and the whole remnant ( AI ) of the people obeyed ( AJ ) the voice of the Lord their God and the message of the prophet Haggai, because the Lord their God had sent him. And the people feared ( AK ) the Lord .

13.verse: Then Haggai, ( AL ) the Lord ’s messenger, ( AM ) gave this message of the Lord to the people: “I am with ( AN ) you,” declares the Lord .

14.verse: So the Lord stirred up ( AO ) the spirit of Zerubbabel ( AP ) son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua son of Jozadak, ( AQ ) the high priest, and the spirit of the whole remnant ( AR ) of the people. They came and began to work on the house of the Lord Almighty, their God,

15.verse: on the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month. ( AS )

1.verse: on the twenty-first day of the seventh month, ( A ) the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai: ( B )

2.verse: “Speak to Zerubbabel ( C ) son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, to Joshua son of Jozadak,  ( D ) the high priest, and to the remnant ( E ) of the people. Ask them,

3.verse: ‘Who of you is left who saw this house ( F ) in its former glory? How does it look to you now? Does it not seem to you like nothing? ( G )

4.verse: But now be strong, Zerubbabel,’ declares the Lord . ‘Be strong, ( H ) Joshua son of Jozadak, ( I ) the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land,’ declares the Lord , ‘and work. For I am with ( J ) you,’ declares the Lord Almighty.

5.verse: ‘This is what I covenanted ( K ) with you when you came out of Egypt. ( L ) And my Spirit ( M ) remains among you. Do not fear.’ ( N )

6.verse: “This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘In a little while ( O ) I will once more shake the heavens and the earth, ( P ) the sea and the dry land.

7.verse: I will shake all nations, and what is desired ( Q ) by all nations will come, and I will fill this house ( R ) with glory, ( S ) ’ says the Lord Almighty.

8.verse: ‘The silver is mine and the gold ( T ) is mine,’ declares the Lord Almighty.

9.verse: ‘The glory ( U ) of this present house ( V ) will be greater than the glory of the former house,’ says the Lord Almighty. ‘And in this place I will grant peace, ( W ) ’ declares the Lord Almighty.”

10.verse: On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, ( X ) in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Haggai:

11.verse: “This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Ask the priests ( Y ) what the law says:

12.verse: If someone carries consecrated meat ( Z ) in the fold of their garment, and that fold touches some bread or stew, some wine, olive oil or other food, does it become consecrated? ( AA ) ’”

13.verse: Then Haggai said, “If a person defiled by contact with a dead body touches one of these things, does it become defiled?”

14.verse: Then Haggai said, “‘So it is with this people ( AC ) and this nation in my sight,’ declares the Lord . ‘Whatever they do and whatever they offer ( AD ) there is defiled.

15.verse: “‘Now give careful thought ( AE ) to this from this day on  —consider how things were before one stone was laid ( AF ) on another in the Lord ’s temple. ( AG )

16.verse: When anyone came to a heap ( AH ) of twenty measures, there were only ten. When anyone went to a wine vat ( AI ) to draw fifty measures, there were only twenty. ( AJ )

17.verse: I struck all the work of your hands ( AK ) with blight, ( AL ) mildew and hail, ( AM ) yet you did not return ( AN ) to me,’ declares the Lord . ( AO )

18.verse: ‘From this day on, from this twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, give careful thought ( AP ) to the day when the foundation ( AQ ) of the Lord ’s temple was laid. Give careful thought:

19.verse: Is there yet any seed left in the barn? Until now, the vine and the fig tree, the pomegranate ( AR ) and the olive tree have not borne fruit. ( AS )

20.verse: The word of the Lord came to Haggai ( AU ) a second time on the twenty-fourth day of the month: ( AV )

21.verse: “Tell Zerubbabel ( AW ) governor of Judah that I am going to shake ( AX ) the heavens and the earth.

22.verse: I will overturn ( AY ) royal thrones and shatter the power of the foreign kingdoms. ( AZ ) I will overthrow chariots ( BA ) and their drivers; horses and their riders ( BB ) will fall, each by the sword of his brother. ( BC )

23.verse: “‘On that day, ( BD ) ’ declares the Lord Almighty, ‘I will take you, my servant ( BE ) Zerubbabel ( BF ) son of Shealtiel,’ declares the Lord , ‘and I will make you like my signet ring, ( BG ) for I have chosen you,’ declares the Lord Almighty.”
